importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The first Nobel Prize of the 2025 cycle was announced on this date, marking the official start of the award season and generating global attention.
The final Nobel Prize of the 2025 cycle, the Economics Prize, is announced on this date, concluding a week of high-profile announcements.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: This week-long period is critical as it represents the annual global anticipation and public discourse surrounding the Nobel Prizes, affecting science, politics, and media coverage worldwide.

keyTakeAways: The Nobel Prizes are the most prestigious international awards, established by the will of Alfred Nobel, a Swedish chemist, engineer, and industrialist known for discovering dynamite.

The prizes are awarded annually to individuals who have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind in the preceding year, across six categories: physics, chemistry, medicine, literature, peace, and economic sciences.

Each prize is awarded by a specific institution: the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences (physics, chemistry, economics), the Nobel Assembly at Karolinska Institutet (medicine), the Swedish Academy (literature), and the Norwegian Nobel Committee (peace).

The 2025 medicine prize was awarded to Mary Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi for their discoveries concerning peripheral immune tolerance, laying the foundation for new treatments in cancer and autoimmune diseases.
The 2024 medicine prize went to Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun for discovering microRNAs, which regulate gene expression.
The 2024 physics prize was awarded to John Hopfield and Geoffrey Hinton for foundational work in machine learning and artificial neural networks.
The 2024 chemistry prize was shared by David Baker, Demis Hassabis, and John Jumper for breakthroughs in protein structure prediction using AI, including the development of AlphaFold.
The 2024 literature prize went to South Korean author Han Kang for her poetic exploration of violence and human fragility in works like The Vegetarian and Human Acts.
The 2024 peace prize was awarded to Nihon Hidankyo, an organization representing survivors of nuclear bombings, for its long-term advocacy against nuclear weapons.
The 2024 economics prize was awarded to Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson, and James Robinson for demonstrating that inclusive institutions are key to long-term economic growth and reduced inequality.

The nominations process is confidential, with experts, past winners, and academics invited to submit nominations by January 31; decisions are kept secret for 50 years, and no self-nominations are allowed.

The Peace Prize often responds to current global events, with significant public debate this year focused on U.S. President Donald Trump’s claims of deserving the prize for ending wars, though experts say his chances are slim due to the focus on durable peace and institutional work.

The Trump administration’s political interference in academia has raised concerns about academic freedom, with Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences vice president Ylva Engstrom warning of long-term damage to democratic institutions.

The laureates are formally presented on December 10, Nobel’s death anniversary, with ceremonies in Stockholm and Oslo, attended by royalty, diplomats, and global leaders, broadcast worldwide and followed by a Nobel Banquet.

namedEntities.name: Alfred Nobel
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Swedish chemist, engineer, and industrialist who founded the Nobel Prizes through his will.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the originator of the Nobel Prizes, which are the most prestigious international awards in the world and central to the article’s narrative.

namedEntities.name: Mary Brunkow
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A scientist awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Medicine for discoveries in immune tolerance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is one of the laureates recognized for groundbreaking work in medicine, directly tied to the article’s focus on the 2025 prize announcement.

namedEntities.name: Fred Ramsdell
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A scientist awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Medicine for discoveries in immune tolerance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is one of the laureates recognized for pivotal research in medicine, contributing to the article’s medical discovery narrative.

namedEntities.name: Shimon Sakaguchi
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A scientist awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Medicine for discoveries in immune tolerance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is one of the laureates recognized for foundational work in immune tolerance, central to the medical prize discussion.

namedEntities.name: Victor Ambros
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A scientist awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Medicine for discovering microRNAs.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His 2024 work provides context for the medical field’s evolution and is referenced in the article as a precedent for the 2025 award.

namedEntities.name: Gary Ruvkun
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A scientist awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Medicine for discovering microRNAs.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His research complements Victor Ambros’s and shows the long-term impact of medical discoveries.

namedEntities.name: John Hopfield
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A physicist awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Physics for foundational work in machine learning and neural networks.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His work is cited as a major milestone in AI and modern computing, illustrating the significance of physics-based innovation.

namedEntities.name: Geoffrey Hinton
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A physicist awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Physics for foundational work in machine learning and neural networks.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His research revolutionized deep learning and AI, making it a key focus in science and public discourse.

namedEntities.name: David Baker
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A scientist awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for breakthroughs in protein structure prediction.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His work in protein design is a key example of computational science and real-world medical applications.

namedEntities.name: Demis Hassabis
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A scientist awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for breakthroughs in protein structure prediction via AI.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His collaboration with Google DeepMind on AlphaFold is a major example of AI-driven scientific discovery.

namedEntities.name: John Jumper
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A scientist awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for breakthroughs in protein structure prediction.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He co-developed AlphaFold, a system that revolutionized the field of structural biology.

namedEntities.name: Han Kang
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A South Korean novelist awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Literature for her poetic exploration of violence and collective memory.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is a key figure in literature, representing the cultural and emotional dimensions of the Nobel Prizes.

namedEntities.name: Nihon Hidankyo
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An organization representing survivors of nuclear bombings, awarded the 2024 Nobel Peace Prize.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It exemplifies how peace prizes focus on institutional efforts to promote global peace and human rights.

namedEntities.name: Daron Acemoglu
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An economist awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences for analyzing institutions and economic growth.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His work on inclusive institutions is central to understanding economic development and inequality.

namedEntities.name: Simon Johnson
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An economist awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences for analyzing institutions and economic growth.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His collaboration with Acemoglu and Robinson is cited as foundational to modern economic theory.

namedEntities.name: James Robinson
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An economist awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences for analyzing institutions and economic growth.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His research on institutional structures is key to understanding long-term prosperity.

namedEntities.name: United States President Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A political figure who has publicly claimed to deserve the Nobel Peace Prize.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His claims have sparked international debate and scrutiny, highlighting the political controversies surrounding the peace prize.

namedEntities.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Israeli Prime Minister who made a nomination for Donald Trump after the nomination deadline.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His post-deadline nomination reflects political dynamics influencing the nomination process and public discourse.

namedEntities.name: Pakistan Government
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A governmental body that made a nomination for Donald Trump after the deadline.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It adds to the political controversy and illustrates how geopolitical actors participate in the nomination process.

namedEntities.name: Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The institution responsible for awarding the Physics, Chemistry, and Economics Prizes.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It plays a central role in the administrative and scientific selection of laureates, especially in science-based categories.

namedEntities.name: Nobel Assembly at Karolinska Institutet
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The institution responsible for awarding the Medicine Prize.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is specifically noted as the body that announced the 2025 Medicine Prize, anchoring the article’s timeline and process.

namedEntities.name: Swedish Academy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The institution responsible for awarding the Literature Prize.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is the body that awarded Han Kang in 2024, illustrating the cultural dimensions of the prizes.

namedEntities.name: Norwegian Nobel Committee
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The institution responsible for awarding the Peace Prize.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is central to the discussion of the 2025 Peace Prize, especially in relation to political claims by Trump and the committee’s criteria.

namedEntities.name: Sveriges Riksbank
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The central bank of Sweden that established the Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides historical context for the expansion of the Nobel Prizes from five to six categories.

namedEntities.name: Nobel Foundation
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The organization that manages Nobel’s endowment and funds the prize awards.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It ensures the financial sustainability of the prizes and manages the monetary awards of 11 million Swedish kronor each.

namedEntities.name: Ylva Engstrom
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Vice president of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She publicly criticized the Trump administration’s impact on academic freedom, highlighting tensions between politics and science.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The 2025 Nobel Prizes have begun with the announcement of the Medicine Prize to Mary Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi for their discoveries in peripheral immune tolerance, which have advanced research into cancer and autoimmune diseases. The full schedule spans from October 6 to October 13, with each prize awarded by its respective institution. The article details the history, process, and significance of the Nobel Prizes, emphasizing their global prestige and scientific, cultural, and political relevance. It also highlights the controversy surrounding U.S. President Donald Trump’s claims of deserving the Peace Prize, noting that experts and institutions emphasize that the prize rewards durable peace and institutional work, not political self-promotion. The article references past laureates and the nomination process, which maintains strict confidentiality and scientific rigor. It underscores the importance of academic freedom and the role of institutions in maintaining the integrity of the Nobel system.
title: What are Nobel Prizes, when are the awards announced?
